Articles.Content:
I was altering a few parts earlier and thought to myself "I wish this was a little easier".

My suggestion is that you, the company, produce a editing tool that allows the average gamer to tweak their parts. I'm sure that a mod will be produced (or already exists) that can allow us to edit parts but wouldn't it be nice if we were given a polished and reliably updated tool?

Mod makers, while wonderful, cannot update their mods forever.. I don't blame them, of course. Life happens.

I'm not saying this should be produced anytime soon; but after the game is completed.

That sounds more like a mod than a core game feature to me.

Though who knows, maybe after KSP is finished they could release some tools to make modding easier. That would directly result in the fulfillment of your request
It's already not THAT hard to change part performance, or even to rescale parts. To actually change the modules and textures on the other hand is never really going to be a simple process.

By easier I mean convenient. As with anything, practice makes the process easier and faster. But for newcomers, or those that never really delve into this type of thing, it would be nice to have a tool that makes the process simpler.

For instance: Just to edit the Ion engine (to my desired use) I had to change the Xenon fuel weight (Resource file), the Xenon tank's fuel quantity (Tank part file), and the engine's thrust/electrical usage (Engine part file). With my very limited experience, the process took me about an hour of looking up information and game testing.
I thought you were going to suggest twerking kerbals!
